content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-076-03-A |Item_parent=Alcohol dependence |Item_parent_short=Alcohol dependence |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the comparative elements of dependence (ICD 11) and alcohol use disorder (DSM5) |Description=Dependence (ICD 11) corresponds to moderate to severe alcohol use disorders (DSM5). |Rubric=Definition |Contributors= |Order=3}} DSM-5 defines "alcohol use disorder" as mild, moderate or severe, using the same criteria as the ICD. Dependence (ICD) corresponds to moderate and severe "alcohol use disorder" (DSM-5).

question.question: According to the ICD-11 and DSM-5, which of the following statements accurately describes the relationship between 'dependence' and 'alcohol use disorder'?
question.option_a: Dependence (ICD-11) corresponds to mild, moderate, and severe alcohol use disorders (DSM-5).
question.option_b: Dependence (ICD-11) corresponds only to severe alcohol use disorders (DSM-5).
question.option_c: Dependence (ICD-11) corresponds to moderate to severe alcohol use disorders (DSM-5).
question.option_d: Dependence (ICD-11) is a separate condition from alcohol use disorders (DSM-5).
